globals_schema.formatted_revenue_report_T001:
Dhurandhar Movie Revenue Report (as of December 2025)

This report details the revenue generated by the movie "Dhurandhar" as of December 2025. The data presented is compiled from available sources and provides a comprehensive overview of the movie's financial performance.

Executive Summary

"Dhurandhar" has achieved significant box office success, generating substantial revenue worldwide. As of December 23, 2025, the movie has grossed $21,877,727,399 globally. Earlier data, from December 22, 2025, indicates the movie grossed over Rs 800 crore (8 billion) worldwide, with an estimated $108,120,000 USD. The India collection totaled Rs 712.98 crore, and overseas gross collection reached Rs 188.02 crore. These figures highlight the strong performance of "Dhurandhar" in both domestic and international markets. Discrepancies in reported revenue figures are discussed below.

Revenue Breakdown

Worldwide Gross Revenue

As of December 23, 2025, "Dhurandhar" has a worldwide gross revenue of $21,877,727,399. This figure represents the most up-to-date information available regarding the movie's total earnings.

Revenue as of December 22, 2025

On December 22, 2025, the movie had grossed over Rs 800 crore (8 billion) worldwide. In USD terms, the revenue was approximately $108,120,000. This includes:

  • India Collection: Rs 712.98 crore
  • Overseas Gross Collection: Rs 188.02 crore

Revenue Data Table

Date Revenue (USD) Revenue (INR) Region
December 23, 2025 $21,877,727,399 N/A Worldwide
December 22, 2025 $108,120,000 (Estimated) Rs 800 crore (Approx.) Worldwide
December 22, 2025 N/A Rs 712.98 crore India
December 22, 2025 N/A Rs 188.02 crore Overseas

Analysis of Revenue Discrepancies

There is a significant discrepancy between the reported revenue as of December 23, 2025 ($21,877,727,399) and the estimated revenue as of December 22, 2025 ($108,120,000). This difference could be attributed to several factors:

  • Data Source Reliability: The accuracy and reliability of the sources providing the revenue data may vary.
  • Currency Conversion Rates: Fluctuations in currency exchange rates between INR and USD can affect the converted revenue figures.
  • Reporting Delays: There may be delays in reporting revenue from different regions, leading to incomplete data on December 22, 2025.
  • Data Updates: The December 23, 2025 figure may include updated revenue data from additional sources or regions not accounted for in the December 22, 2025 estimate.
  • Possible Error It is possible that one of the revenue figures is incorrect. With such a large difference in revenue on back to back days, this is a plausible explanation.

Further investigation into the data sources and reporting methodologies is recommended to reconcile these discrepancies and provide a more accurate and consistent revenue picture.

Conclusion

"Dhurandhar" has demonstrated a strong financial performance, achieving significant revenue both in India and worldwide. While there are discrepancies in the reported revenue figures, the overall success of the movie is evident. Continued monitoring of revenue data and reconciliation of discrepancies will provide a more accurate understanding of the movie's financial impact.

India Today Entertainment Desk New Delhi , UPDATED: Jan 8, 2026 09:40 IST Dhurandhar , the action drama directed by Aditya Dhar, has made history at the Indian box office. On Wednesday, January 7, 2026, the film became the highest-earning Hindi film ever, overtaking the previous record held by Allu Arjuns Pushpa 2: The Rule . With this achievement, Dhurandhar continues a strong run in cinemas across India and abroad, drawing sustained audience interest well into its fifth week. advertisement The film's India net collection reached an estimated Rs 831.40 crore at the end of day 34, according to figures released by the producers. Its total worldwide gross has climbed to approximately Rs 1,227 crore, which includes Rs 943 crore in India and Rs 284 crore from overseas markets. The Hindi version alone recorded over 10% occupancy on its fifth Wednesday, a remarkable feat for a film more than a month into its release. In comparison to other major releases, Dhurandhar surpassed Pushpa 2: The Rule's Hindi lifetime total of around Rs 830 crore net. It also outperformed past blockbusters like Shah Rukh Khans Jawan (RS 643 crore net) and the horror-comedy Stree 2 (Rs 627 crore net), firmly establishing its place at the top of the Hindi film earnings chart. According to box office tracking, the film earned approximately Rs 4.25 crore on day 34. Throughout its run, the movie has consistently posted strong weekly collections, with week five's net total standing at Rs 47 crore. Dhurandhar recorded the highest fifth week collections in recent years, including an estimated RS 33.25 crore over just three days, overtaking Chhaava's previous record. Dhurandhar 's regional performance remains strong, particularly in major cities like Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, and Pune, each recording above 10 per cent occupancy. For instance, Chennai recorded an occupancy rate of 24.5 per cent on Wednesday, while Bengaluru reached 15.75 per cent. These figures highlight the film's widespread appeal and enduring presence in multiplexes nationwide. The sequel is expected to continue from the cliffhanger ending. International records for Dhurandhar include being the no. 1 Hindi-language film of all time in North America; the no. 2 Indian film of all time in North America; the no. 1 Indian film of all time in Canada and Australia; and the no. 4 Indian film of all time in the U.K., per Jio Studios. In the pantheon of all-time highest grossers locally in India, Dhurandhar is currently at no. 4, behind Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ($159 million, Telugu-language and dubbed versions), Pushpa 2: The Rule ($153.5 million, Telugu-language and dubbed versions), and K.G.F: Chapter 2 ($112 million, Kannada-language and dubbed versions). Among the highest grossing Indian films of all time worldwide, Dhurandhar currently occupies the fifth spot behind Dangal ($244.5 million), Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ($201.2 million), Pushpa 2: The Rule ($200 million) and RRR ($154 million). Dhurandhar 2 will bow March 19, simultaneously releasing in the Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam languages in a pan-India and global rollout a significant expansion from the originals Hindi-only theatrical run. The decision to mount a five-language release came in response to unprecedented demand from South Indian markets, despite the first films Hindi-only availability. globals_schema.formatted_revenue_report_T003:
Dhurandhar Movie Revenue Report (as of January 7, 2026)

This report details the revenue generated by the movie "Dhurandhar" as of January 7, 2026. It compiles data from reputable sources to provide a comprehensive overview of the movie's financial performance.

Executive Summary

"Dhurandhar" has achieved remarkable box office success, becoming the highest-earning Hindi film of all time. As of January 7, 2026, the film has grossed Rs 1,227 crore worldwide. The film's India net collection reached Rs 831.40 crore, with overseas markets contributing significantly to its total earnings. "Dhurandhar" has surpassed previous benchmarks, outperforming major releases such as "Pushpa 2: The Rule", "Jawan", and "Stree 2". Its strong performance reflects sustained audience interest both in India and abroad.

Revenue Breakdown

Worldwide Gross Revenue

As of January 7, 2026, "Dhurandhar" has a worldwide gross revenue of Rs 1,227 crore. This figure underscores the movie's global appeal and financial success. According to India Today, the movie has become the highest-earning Hindi film of all time.

India Net Collection

The film's India net collection reached an estimated Rs 831.40 crore by the end of day 34. This robust domestic performance is a key driver of the movie's overall success. The movie has surpassed Pushpa 2: The Rule's Hindi lifetime total, which was around Rs 830 crore net.

Regional Performance

"Dhurandhar" has shown strong regional performance, particularly in major cities such as Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, and Pune. These cities have recorded above 10 percent occupancy, highlighting the film's widespread appeal across different regions in India. For example, Chennai recorded an occupancy rate of 24.5 percent on Wednesday, January 7, 2026, while Bengaluru reached 15.75 percent.

Comparative Analysis

"Dhurandhar" has outperformed several major releases, solidifying its position as a top-grossing Hindi film. The film has surpassed "Pushpa 2: The Rule"'s Hindi lifetime total of around Rs 830 crore net. It has also outperformed past blockbusters such as Shah Rukh Khan's "Jawan" (Rs 643 crore net) and the horror-comedy "Stree 2" (Rs 627 crore net), firmly establishing its place at the top of the Hindi film earnings chart.

Future Outlook

Building on the success of "Dhurandhar", the makers have already announced its Part 2, which is set to be released in March 2026. This sequel is expected to further expand the franchise's reach and solidify its position in the Indian film industry. The continued success of "Dhurandhar" highlights the enduring appeal of well-crafted action dramas and the strong audience demand for quality Hindi cinema.

India Today Entertainment Desk New Delhi , UPDATED: Jan 8, 2026 09:40 IST Dhurandhar , the action drama directed by Aditya Dhar, has made history at the Indian box office. On Wednesday, January 7, 2026, the film became the highest-earning Hindi film ever, overtaking the previous record held by Allu Arjuns Pushpa 2: The Rule . With this achievement, Dhurandhar continues a strong run in cinemas across India and abroad, drawing sustained audience interest well into its fifth week. advertisement The film's India net collection reached an estimated Rs 831.40 crore at the end of day 34, according to figures released by the producers. Its total worldwide gross has climbed to approximately Rs 1,227 crore, which includes Rs 943 crore in India and Rs 284 crore from overseas markets. The Hindi version alone recorded over 10% occupancy on its fifth Wednesday, a remarkable feat for a film more than a month into its release. In comparison to other major releases, Dhurandhar surpassed Pushpa 2: The Rule's Hindi lifetime total of around Rs 830 crore net. It also outperformed past blockbusters like Shah Rukh Khans Jawan (RS 643 crore net) and the horror-comedy Stree 2 (Rs 627 crore net), firmly establishing its place at the top of the Hindi film earnings chart. According to box office tracking, the film earned approximately Rs 4.25 crore on day 34. Throughout its run, the movie has consistently posted strong weekly collections, with week five's net total standing at Rs 47 crore. Dhurandhar recorded the highest fifth week collections in recent years, including an estimated RS 33.25 crore over just three days, overtaking Chhaava's previous record. Dhurandhar 's regional performance remains strong, particularly in major cities like Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, and Pune, each recording above 10 per cent occupancy. For instance, Chennai recorded an occupancy rate of 24.5 per cent on Wednesday, while Bengaluru reached 15.75 per cent. These figures highlight the film's widespread appeal and enduring presence in multiplexes nationwide. Aditya Dhar directed the film, with Jio Studios and B62 Studios producing. Singhleads the cast, with Akshaye Khanna playing the antagonist. The cast also includes Sanjay Dutt, R. Popular on Variety Dhurandhar is told in two parts, with the first installment following a decade-long Indian intelligence operation where an undercover agent infiltrates Karachis criminal and political underworld. The sequel is expected to continue from the cliffhanger ending. International records for Dhurandhar include being the no. 1 Hindi-language film of all time in North America; the no. 2 Indian film of all time in North America; the no. 1 Indian film of all time in Canada and Australia; and the no. 4 Indian film of all time in the U.K., per Jio Studios. In the pantheon of all-time highest grossers locally in India, Dhurandhar is currently at no. 4, behind Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ($159 million, Telugu-language and dubbed versions), Pushpa 2: The Rule ($153.5 million, Telugu-language and dubbed versions), and K.G.F: Chapter 2 ($112 million, Kannada-language and dubbed versions). Among the highest grossing Indian films of all time worldwide, Dhurandhar currently occupies the fifth spot behind Dangal ($244.5 million), Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ($201.2 million), Pushpa 2: The Rule ($200 million) and RRR ($154 million). Dhurandhar 2 will bow March 19, simultaneously releasing in the Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam languages in a pan-India and global rollout a significant expansion from the originals Hindi-only theatrical run. The decision to mount a five-language release came in response to unprecedented demand from South Indian markets, despite the first films Hindi-only availability. output.formatted_revenue_report_T003:
Dhurandhar Movie Revenue Report (as of January 7, 2026)

This report details the revenue generated by the movie "Dhurandhar" as of January 7, 2026. It compiles data from reputable sources to provide a comprehensive overview of the movie's financial performance.

Executive Summary

"Dhurandhar" has achieved remarkable box office success, becoming the highest-earning Hindi film of all time. As of January 7, 2026, the film has grossed Rs 1,227 crore worldwide. The film's India net collection reached Rs 831.40 crore, with overseas markets contributing significantly to its total earnings. "Dhurandhar" has surpassed previous benchmarks, outperforming major releases such as "Pushpa 2: The Rule", "Jawan", and "Stree 2". Its strong performance reflects sustained audience interest both in India and abroad.

Revenue Breakdown

Worldwide Gross Revenue

As of January 7, 2026, "Dhurandhar" has a worldwide gross revenue of Rs 1,227 crore. This figure underscores the movie's global appeal and financial success. According to India Today, the movie has become the highest-earning Hindi film of all time.

India Net Collection

The film's India net collection reached an estimated Rs 831.40 crore by the end of day 34. This robust domestic performance is a key driver of the movie's overall success. The movie has surpassed Pushpa 2: The Rule's Hindi lifetime total, which was around Rs 830 crore net.

Regional Performance

"Dhurandhar" has shown strong regional performance, particularly in major cities such as Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, and Pune. These cities have recorded above 10 percent occupancy, highlighting the film's widespread appeal across different regions in India. For example, Chennai recorded an occupancy rate of 24.5 percent on Wednesday, January 7, 2026, while Bengaluru reached 15.75 percent.

Comparative Analysis

"Dhurandhar" has outperformed several major releases, solidifying its position as a top-grossing Hindi film. The film has surpassed "Pushpa 2: The Rule"'s Hindi lifetime total of around Rs 830 crore net. It has also outperformed past blockbusters such as Shah Rukh Khan's "Jawan" (Rs 643 crore net) and the horror-comedy "Stree 2" (Rs 627 crore net), firmly establishing its place at the top of the Hindi film earnings chart.

Future Outlook

Building on the success of "Dhurandhar", the makers have already announced its Part 2, which is set to be released in March 2026. This sequel is expected to further expand the franchise's reach and solidify its position in the Indian film industry. The continued success of "Dhurandhar" highlights the enduring appeal of well-crafted action dramas and the strong audience demand for quality Hindi cinema.
